snippet: In a performance Wednesday night, New York City Ballet presented two works from the repertory as well as a piece that had its premiere earlier this year.
abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews dance works by George Balanchine, Jerome Robbins and Christopher Wheeldon performed by the New York City Ballet at Lincoln Center.
lead_paragraph: In a performance Wednesday night, New York City Ballet presented two works from the repertory as well as a piece that had its premiere earlier this year.

headline.seo: New York City Ballet Revisits Three Works
headline.main: The Elusive Art of Moving Bodies Through Space
headline.print_headline: The Elusive Art of Moving Bodies Through Space
